'''Matthew Paul "Matt" Mira''' (born August 5, 1983) is an [[United States|American]] [[podcast]] host, stand-up [[comedian]] and session guitarist in Los Angeles. He has been a co-host of ''[[The Nerdist Podcast]]'' since 2010.<ref name="leijon">Leijon, Eric (July 28, 2011). [http://www.montrealmirror.com/wp/2011/07/28/the-dean-of-dweebs/ The dean of dweebs.] ''[[Montreal Mirror]]''</ref><ref name="burrows">Burrows, Leah (April 8, 2011). [http://news.bostonherald.com/entertainment/arts_culture/view.bg?&articleid=1329168 Chris Hardwick singles out his nerdiness.] ''[[Boston Herald]]''</ref>
==Life and career== Mira was born in [[Stoneham, Massachusetts]] on August 5, 1983 and grew up in [[Lowell, Massachusetts]]. He is the youngest of four children. His parents are John and Mary Mira. He has two older sisters Kimberly and Julie, and an older brother John. He was raised Catholic, and attended [[Lowell Catholic High School]]. After high school he attended local colleges. He left Massachusetts for [[Los Angeles]] in 2007 to pursue a career in comedy.
From 2008 to 2010, while working as an [[Genius Bar|Apple Genius]], Mira produced the podcast ''Comedy and Everything Else'' featuring [[Todd Glass]] and [[Jimmy Dore]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zvents.com/z/mountain-view-ca/matt-mira--performers--8432545|title=Zvents Performers: Matt Mira}}</ref> Since February 2010, Mira has co-hosted ''The Nerdist Podcast'', with [[Jonah Ray]] and [[Chris Hardwick]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Chris|last=Hardwick|url=http://www.nerdist.com/2010/02/the-nerdist-podcast-now-a-thing/|title=The Nerdist Podcast: Now A Thing!|publisher=nerdist.com|date=February 8, 2010}}</ref> The podcast was named one of 2010's best by [[The A.V. Club]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Erik|last=Adams|first2=Steve|last2=Heisler|first3=Steven|last3=Hyden|first4=Genevieve|last4=Koski|first5=Keith|last5=Phipps|first6=Tasha|last6=Robinson|first7=Kyle|last7=Ryan|first8=Scott|last8=Tobias|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/the-best-podcasts-of-2010,49466/1/|title=The Best Podcasts of 2010|publisher=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=December 29, 2010}}</ref> Mira has appeared as a guest on several other podcasts, including ''[[Sklarbro Country]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/guest/matt-mira|title=Earwolf guest: Matt Mira|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Earwolf|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> and ''[[Doug Loves Movies]]''.<ref name="dlm">Benson, Doug (August 24, 2011). Zach Galifianakis, Nick Swardson, Marc Maron and Matt Mira guest Doug Loves Movies.</ref> In 2011 Mira produced ''ONESTAR,'' a show at [[UCB Theatre|UCB Theatre Los Angeles]] with comedian [[Thomas Lennon (actor)|Thomas Lennon]] in which comedians and actors performed "dramatic readings of the [[Yelp, Inc.|YELP]] reviews of the [[Koreatown, Los Angeles|Koreatown]] [[24 Hour Fitness]]."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/shows/2632|title=Matt Mira & Thomas Lennon present ONESTAR|publisher=Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre}}</ref> Mira now hosts a weekly open mic at the NerdMelt theatre at Meltdown Comics in Los Angeles titled ''Nerdist Open Mic'', formerly titled ''Matt Mira's Day Off''.<ref>{{cite web|first=Chris|last=Hardwick|url=http://www.laweekly.com/events/matt-miras-day-off-1262544/|title=Matt Mira's Day Off: Warning: The Following Item Is an Open Mic|publisher=[[LA Weekly]]}}</ref> In May 2011, [[BBC America]] commissioned a pilot based on ''The Nerdist Podcast'', hosted by its creator, comedian [[Chris Hardwick]] and featuring [[Jonah Ray]] and Mira in their usual co-hosting roles.<ref name="mol">Wicks, Kevin (May 23, 2011). [http://blogs.bbcamerica.com/anglophenia/2011/05/23/chris-hardwick-to-host-ministry-of-laughs-and-nerdist-pilot-for-bbc-america/ Anglophenia: Chris Hardwick to host "Ministry of Laughs" and Nerdist pilot for BBC America.] [[BBC America]]</ref> Mira announced on ''The Nerdist Podcast'' that he had accepted a job as the new gadget producer on [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4]]'s ''[[Attack of the Show]]''.<ref>{{cite web|first=Chris|last=Hardwick|url=http://www.nerdist.com/2011/08/nerdist-podcast-112-the-dork-backward/|title=Nerdist Podcast #112}}</ref> In January 2012, he began making on-air appearances for the segment. Beginning in July 2012, Mira co-hosted ''[[Attack of the Show]]'' up until its final episode on January 23, 2013.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.g4tv.com/videos/59991/matt-mira-on-tsa-robots-google/|title=Mira Co-Host AoTS}}</ref>
A video featuring a golf-cart running over Matt has been featured on the TV shows ''[[tosh.0]]'', ''[[Country Fried Home Videos]]'', and ''[[World's Dumbest...]]''.
Beginning in March 2012, Matt began co-hosting an occasional podcast with film producer [[Scott Mosier]] called ''FEaB'' (Four Eyes and Beard), a joint production of [[The Nerdist Podcast|Nerdist Industries]] and [[SModcast|SModcast.com]].
As of September 2013, Matt co-hosts ''James Bonding'' with [[Matt Gourley]] (and guests), an [[Earwolf]] podcast where they discuss [[James Bond]] movies.
Since October 2013, Mira has been writing for the [[Chris Hardwick]] hosted ''[[@midnight]]'' on Comedy Central.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4579890/?ref_=ttfc_fc_wr1|title=Mira writes on @Midnight}}</ref>
On June 19, 2015, [[Kevin Smith]] announced via [[Facebook]] that he and Mira "will provide a commentary track for every single episode of ''[[Frasier]]''" on a new podcast entitled ''Talk Salad & Scrambled Eggs'' ''- Frasier Reconsidered w/ Matt Mira & Kevin Smith''.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10152834327816930&substory_index=0&id=6985046929|title=Kevin Smith â€“ New Podcast! @mattmira & I will provide a commentary track for every single episode of Frasier on Talk Salad & Scrambled Eggs!}}</ref>
As of 2016, Mira currently is writing for [[The Goldbergs (2013 TV series)|''The Goldbergs'']] on ABC. He also hosts a podcast with his wife Doree Shafrir about their journey about making a baby with science called Matt & Doree's Eggcelent Adventure.
Starting January 8, 2017, Matt began co-hosting the podcast 'Star Trek: The Next Conversation' with fellow 'The Goldbergs' writer Andrew Secunda.
On September 22, 2017, Matt was named host of ''[[After Trek]]'', a live after-show companion to ''[[Star Trek: Discovery]]'' broadcast on [[CBS All Access]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.startrek.com/article/matt-mira-to-host-after-trek|title=Matt Mira To Host After Trek}}</ref>
